intro: Calochortus grandiflorus, commonly known as the showy glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Calochortus grandiflorus is known for its early blooming period, often appearing in late winter or early spring.
